unit.utterance: Too go taap̃es rapiatlak, ratmer piaselkir Rato ur naor iskei.
unit.utterance_translation: The chicken and the swamphen were friends. They stayed at one place.

unit.utterance: Me nrak iskei go ratli na rakfan los.
unit.utterance_translation: Then one time they said that they would go for a swim.

unit.utterance: Kotfan nrak iskei go ratli na rakfan los elau.
unit.utterance_translation: One afternoon they said they would go and swim in the sea.

unit.utterance: Ale rana rato rapan los elau.
unit.utterance_translation: So then they wanted to go for a swim in the sea.

unit.utterance: Me nlaken nser ne. Nser nen too isuun to. Nki.
unit.utterance_translation: But because of the comb. That comb that it put on its head. That one.

unit.utterance: Ga teni taap̃es, ipi nser ni taap̃es, tene, ipi teni taap̃es.
unit.utterance_translation: This one is the swamphen's comb.

unit.utterance: Me tene ipi teni too. Gawanki. Ale rato rapan los elau.
unit.utterance_translation: But this one is the chicken's. Like that. Okay they went and swam in the sea.

unit.utterance: Me nlaken too kipe lewiki kom ni taap̃es.
unit.utterance_translation: But because the chicken liked the swamphen's comb,

unit.utterance: Malen rapato los pan, go too inrik taap̃es ki na, "Ag p̃afei to me kineu kafei sak."
unit.utterance_translation: When they went swimming the chicken said to the swamphen, "You stay here first and I'll get out."

unit.utterance: Ina ipa na ikalki nkal ga inom. Me imailum pnaklu kom ni taap̃es, ipaskin np̃aun
unit.utterance_translation: He wanted to go to dress in his clothes. Then he quietly, completely stole the swamphen's comb and put it on his head.

unit.utterance: Isef kaipa, me taap̃es ipen los, ipen los panpan na imai na ikalki nkal ga pan inom.
unit.utterance_translation: He ran away and went, then the swamphen swam there until he came to get dressed.

unit.utterance: Me ilel kom ga me kom ga ipuel, nlaken too kipe pnakon pa. Me ni too kom ga ito.
unit.utterance_translation: Then he looked for his comb, but it was gone, because the chicken had stolen it and gone. But the chicken's comb was still there.

unit.utterance: Taap̃es inrogtesa. Too ipnak kom ni taap̃es.
unit.utterance_translation: The swamphen felt bad. The chicken stole the comb from the swamphen.

unit.utterance: Isemsemwes go kipe to ur esum̃ ur narmal, itu fekfeki kom, nlaken kin ipnakon,
unit.utterance_translation: He was happy because of it, and he went around the house and the yard and he showed off, because he had stolen it.

unit.utterance: kom ni taap̃es. Me taap̃es ina ipan na ikal su, me ileka ki kom ga ipuel.
unit.utterance_translation: the comb from the swamphen. And the swamphen wanted to get dressed, but he saw that his comb was missing.

unit.utterance: Me kom ni too, ito. Go ina isati kaipsi np̃aun me inrogtesa.
unit.utterance_translation: But the chicken's comb was there. And he wanted to get it and he he put it on his head, but he felt bad.

unit.utterance: Imaet go kisef pan kus namlas, ipan kus namlas, go kito ur namlas.
unit.utterance_translation: He got angry and he ran away to hide in the bush, he hid in the bush, and he wandered in the bush.

unit.utterance: Go mees kutae pam̃or too kin ito ur esum̃, nlaken kin ipnak kom ni taap̃es.
unit.utterance_translation: And today you will find that the chicken stays around the house because it stole the swamphen's comb.

unit.utterance: Taap̃es imalier kom ni too, nlaken isees go kisef pan kus namlas.
unit.utterance_translation: The swamphen is ashamed of the chicken's comb because it is small and he runs and hides in the bush.

unit.utterance: Nafuserekwen ni taap̃es go too itefla.
unit.utterance_translation: The story of the chicken and the swamphen is like that.
